Context:  I am writing code that monitors the frequency, timing, and
result=
s of tests, and the code needs must run from eclipse, intellij,
etc, relati=
vely invisibly to the user.

As far as I can tell, the only way to add a li=
stener is to do it
through the JUnitCore class.  Unfortunately, I can't use=
 the standard
formula of running from main().

Is there a way to add a list=
ener from elsewhere in the dynamic object
tree?

I have a deliciously crude=
 hack:  Use RunsWith and a custom runner,
then change the invokeMethod stat=
ement so that I can gather the info I
need.  It would be so much nicer if I=
 could just add a listener, tho,
because my hack would require me to extrac=
t all the info, which in
fact a listener already gets all nicely packaged.
=

Ideas?
Hill
